channel.title: Christmas Event Development team!
channel.description:
We know it's a while away, but Lagex wishes to have a fully working "Christmas Event" next year.
[b]Plans[/b]
1. We'll copy our current source. It will not be run until Christmas, which will save us from losing current source data.
2. We need 2-3 people to help in the creation of the Marionette event!
3. We aim to have it fully working soon, but we want to make sure we give it enough time.
[b]Fill out the following form, and PM it to me.[/b]
[code] Name: Age: Experience: 1-10 how much can you help?: Windows live/Yahoo:[/code]

item.title: Christmas Event Development team!
item.dc:creator: @Runer_King Runer King
item.description:
@Runer_King wrote:

[quote=“Lusfr, post:9, topic:176359”]I do the same, except when player really want something you have to be able to do it yourself.

and do it ahead of time. you know jagex already has all the events for this year done just not released.[/quote]
That’s why I am doing this. I just want some help. I know Jagex doesn’t have just 1 person working on it.
They have like 10-15.
#####################
Does anyone want to help or not?
It’s going to be a fun project…

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Event Development team!
item.dc:creator: @Runer_King Runer King
item.description:
@Runer_King wrote:

[quote=“Lusfr, post:7, topic:176359”][quote author=Runer King link=topic=237075.msg2017031#msg2017031 date=1201411782]

Why do you need a dev team for a 15 minute event

ROFL. There’s 32 global objects to get working.
They’ll produce over 20 items randomly. Then you have to make baubles color. Its hard work.
I don’t want a dumb Dodian event, where they put everything so close and it’s all easy.
############################################################
I also invited you to help.
I wanted to get “everything” working right. Not just some things.
[/quote]

He’s right it takes ,maybe 5 minutes if you have the right methods.

also you should be ding a valentines event not Christmas[/quote]
If you logged in, I can show you how many global objects are going to have to work.
I also don’t have any right methods, that’s why I am asking for a little help.
If I don’t get help, I will just get lazy, and forget the whole thing.

Read full topic
